content.title: Type B Aortic Dissection
content.description: Aortic dissection originating distal to the left subclavian artery, managed medically if uncomplicated or with TEVAR if complicated.

uncomplicated_vs_complicated.uncomplicated: No malperfusion, controlled hypertension, no rupture

intervention_indications.preventive: Increasing evidence for early TEVAR even in uncomplicated (INSTEAD-XL, ADSORB data)

treatment_options.tevar: Primary therapy for complicated Type B
treatment_options.open: Reserved for connective tissue disorders, failed TEVAR
treatment_options.hybrid: Complex cases requiring arch or visceral revascularization

content.statement: Type B Aortic Dissection is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Aortic-Dissection that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Type B Aortic Dissection helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Type B Aortic Dissection include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Type B Aortic Dissection.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Type B Aortic Dissection. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
